intro: Sidalcea cusickii subsp. purpurea, commonly known as the purple checker-mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species for pollinators and ecological studies in its native range.
